description: a(1)=4; if n = Product p_i^e_i, n>1, then a(n) = Product p_{i+1}^{e_i+1}.
references: From a puzzle proposed by _Marc LeBrun_.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a[1]=4; a[n_] := Thread[f = FactorInteger[n]; Times @@ Power[f[[All, 1]] // NextPrime , f[[All, 2]] + 1]]; Array[a, 50] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 03 2015 *)
prog: (Haskell)a045967 1 = 4a045967 n = product $ zipWith (^)            (map a151800 $ a027748_row n) (map (+ 1) $ a124010_row n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 03 2013, Dec 23 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
